content: Act as someone who is currently feeling Anxious because of an experience related to their Friends, and is looking for someone to talk about the experience.

I'm really struggling with some anxiety right now because of something that happened with my friends. We were supposed to hangout last weekend, but everyone canceled last minute without giving a real reason. I know everyone is busy these days, but it just left me feeling so disappointed and ignored.

I keep overthinking the situation, wondering if I did something to upset them or if they just don't value our friendship anymore. The uncertainty is just eating me up inside and making it hard to focus on anything else. I wish I could just talk to someone about how I'm feeling and get some reassurance that everything is okay.

I really don't want this to affect our friendships, but I'm struggling to brush off these negative thoughts. Just talking to someone and getting some perspective on the situation would mean a lot to me right now. I need to work through these feelings and find a way to move past this.
Damn, that's crazy how everyone dipped on you like that. I definitely see how that can be hella disappointing. If you don't mind me asking, do you have anything in mind on why they would do so?

I know, right? It was really unexpected and disappointing. I've been racking my brain trying to come up with a reason why they would all cancel at the same time. I keep playing back everything leading up to the hangout to see if there were any signs that they were all going to bail, but I just come up empty.

I've been friends with them for a long time, so it's hard for me to understand why they would do this. I'm hoping it's just some kind of misunderstanding or miscommunication, but the uncertainty is really making my anxieties worse. Having someone to bounce ideas off of and provide a listening ear during this confusing time would be really helpful.

Well it sounds like you didn't do anything to cause them to act like so. Does make it weird why they would ditch you. A miscommunication makes sense. You said they didn't give you real reasons right, have you asked them about it since?

Yeah, you're right. I haven't been able to trace it back to anything that I might have done to cause them to cancel. That makes me feel a little bit better, but I still can't shake this feeling of anxiety about the situation.

I did reach out to a couple of them to ask if everything was okay and if there was a specific reason why they all had to cancel. But the responses I got were pretty vague and didn't really provide any clarity. It just felt like everyone was brushing it off, and that's what's fueling my anxiety about the whole thing.

I'm not someone who likes to sit in uncertainty, so not knowing whether there's a real issue or just a misunderstanding is eating away at me. I just can't shake this feeling of anxiety and I need someone to help me talk this through. Thanks for chatting with me about it. It really helps to get this out there.

Yeah, the uncertainty is definitely unnerving. Having your friends potentially hate you is definitely a scary idea. Pretty weird too that they only gave vague responses. Though, since you didn't do anything wrong it sounds like you can take solace in that. Do you have any plans on what to do next?

I really do appreciate your understanding. It helps to talk about it and acknowledge that there may not be a clear reason for their behavior.

As for what I plan to do next, I think I might reach out directly to one or two of my friends and try to have a more open and honest conversation about what happened. It's a tough conversation to have, but I think it's necessary at this point. I do need some reassurance that it was just a misunderstanding or miscommunication to ease my anxiety about the situation.

I just hope it all gets resolved soon because this anxiety is really taking its toll on me. I'd love to find a way to move past this and get back to enjoying my friendships without this cloud of uncertainty hanging over everything. Thank you so much for taking the time to listen and offer your support. It means a lot to me.
Aight, good luck in the conversation. Hope you get the peace of mind you seek. Let me know how the situation develops, best of luck!

Thank you so much for your kind words and support. I really appreciate it. I'll definitely let you know how the conversation goes. Having someone to talk to about all of this is incredibly helpful. I hope I can resolve this situation and find some peace of mind soon. Thanks again for being there for me.
